page.title: 04People of Mowsley & Laughton
page.content: The{population}of the area is about 310;209 in Mowsley, 79 in Laughton,and the rest in outlying farms.The average number of children per family is below 2,and many villagers are over 50 years old.Some older people live alone,a few in large,old houses. In both villages there are families who have occupied homes for 2 or more generations,and "incomers"-especially in the newer houses in Mowsley,and the renovated farms and cottages in Laughton.Most of the{newcomers}take an active part in{village life,}and support the various events.When asked people say the main advanteges of living here are the peace,slower pace of life,the{friendly community,}and the beauty of the countryside.The dis- advantages are mainly the lack of any public transport,and absence of shops, post office and gas.
